info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN CLERMONT, NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND SOUTHEASTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 542 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Batavia, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Milford, Blanchester, Williamsburg, Batavia, Woodville, Owensville, Goshen, Newtonsville, Fayetteville, Chasetown, Perintown, Day Heights, Mount Repose, Edenton, Lake Lorelei and Mulberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
